segments.text: I see the water spilling over the sink, and it’s only getting worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying a plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already wet, but she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while the kitchen is flooding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are too busy with the cookies to notice the water spreading.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and that stool is about to give out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so serene, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone stops the water before the whole floor is ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR
